snippet: On Monday the Australian Chamber Orchestra played works by Webern, Crumb and others at Zankel Hall, joined by Dawn Upshaw.
abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews concert of early 20th-century musical works performed by the Australian Chamber Orchestra at Zankel Hall. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Early-20th-century listeners who had just heard Strauss's luxuriant ''Salome'' and Mahler's decadent ''Symphony of a Thousand,'' which had its premiere in 1910, must have been startled by the brevity and atonal language of Webern's Five Movements for String Quartet (Op. 5), which had its Vienna premiere that same year. But when sandwiched between excerpts from George Crumb's ''Black Angels,'' as the short Webern movements were during a program by the Australian Chamber Orchestra at Zankel Hall on Monday evening, they sounded almost romantic.
